Description: Terracotta statuette of standing woman wearing draped garments, with right hand raised to breast. She holds a flower(?) to her chest. Mould-made and hollow. Fragment of right chest and arm only. Traces of white coating. Light brown clay, with rare mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Rhodian parallels found at Kamiros, dated to the early 5th century BC, or around 450 BC (Higgins 1970, nos. 110-2;142; 210-12 mid 5th century BC; see 284 for late 5th century BC example). Probably made on Rhodes.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.336) (Phase 3)
